parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description:
The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests.

The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: ConnectionString
parameters.description: The endpoint that you want to modify. The endpoint can be a public endpoint or an internal endpoint.

parameters.name: ConnectionStringPrefix
parameters.description: The prefix of the new endpoint. You can modify only the prefix of the endpoint that is specified by the ConnectionString parameter.

parameters.name: DBInstanceEndpointId
parameters.description: The endpoint ID of the instance. You can call the [DescribeDBInstanceEndpoints](~~610488~~) operation to query the endpoint ID of the instance.

parameters.name: DBInstanceId
parameters.description: The instance ID. You can call the [DescribeDBInstances](~~610396~~) operation to query the ID of the instance.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number of the new endpoint.

parameters.name: PrivateIpAddress
parameters.description: The IP address of the internal endpoint.

parameters.name: VSwitchId
parameters.description: The vSwitch ID of the internal endpoint.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The VPC ID of the internal endpoint.
